Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Preface Who This Review Is For

Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Tony Hirst Last generated on 04 October, 2021 Preface Automatically generated stage timing and results for stages on WRC Secto Automotive Rally Finland, 2021. Based on analysis of timing and results data downloaded from the WRC website. To discuss / critique / comment on these analyses, please use the discussion forum. For a guide to the code used to generate the stage reports, see Visualising WRC Rally Results. See also Visualising WRC Rally Stages. This report is unofficial and is not associated in any way with the Fédération Internationale de l’Automobile (FIA) or WRC Promoter GmbH. Who This Review Is For The RallyDataJunkie project, such as it is, is a personal exploration of various ways of representing and visualising rally related stage, timing and results data. There are several potential audiences: rally fans, looking for summaries of rally events; teams and crews, looking for variously arranged summaries to check and compare performances; commentators and journalists, looking for variously arranged summaries and overviews as a tool for confirming or identifying storypoints; data folk, looking for various ways of representing various route, timing or results data.

These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each the stage winner. 2.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 2.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times Pace relative to the stage winner. 3.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 3.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times winner. 4.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 4.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times ROV was in second on stage, 1.8s behind stage winner TÄN in a time of 337.7s and moved up one place to fourth overall. BRE was in third on stage, 2.1s behind TÄN in a time of 338.0s and just 0.3s further back behind ROV. EVA was in fourth place on stage, 1.5s further back behind BRE and moved up one place to third overall. NEU took fifth on stage, 3.7s behind TÄN in a time of 339.6s, just 0.1s off EVA. Pace relative to the stage winner. 5.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 5.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times ROV took second place on stage, 1.0s behind BRE in a time of 597.7s and moved up one place to third overall. TÄN was in third place on stage, 2.3s behind stage winner BRE in a time of 599.0s and retained overall lead of the rally. LAP was in fourth on stage, 2.9s behind stage winner BRE and moved up one place to fourth overall, only 0.6s behind TÄN. EVA took fifth on stage, with a time of 600.8s dropped two places to fifth overall. NEU took sixth place on stage, 6.8s behind the stage winner . KAT took seventh place on stage, with a time of 604.2s , only 0.7s further behind NEU. OGI was in eighth position on stage, with a time of 608.2s . GRE took ninth on stage, 7.3s behind OGI . These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 6.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times LAP was in second position on stage, with a time of 623.1s . BRE was in third on stage, with a time of 625.2s and picked up one place to gain the overall lead . ROV was in fourth on stage, 4.8s behind EVA dropped two places to fifth overall. OGI took fifth place on stage, 1.5s behind ROV . TÄN was in sixth place on stage, 8.0s behind stage winner EVA in a time of 629.5s and dropped one place to lose the overall lead, falling back to second overall. KAT took seventh position on stage, 12.5s behind EVA in a time of 634.0s . NEU took eighth on stage, with a time of 636.8s . GRE took ninth on stage, 12.1s further back behind NEU . These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 7.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 8.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times the overall lead of the rally taking a time of 628.9s. TÄN was in second position on stage, 4.2s further back behind EVA dropped one place to third overall. BRE was in third on stage, 6.8s behind stage winner EVA and dropped one place to lose the overall lead, falling back to second overall. NEU took fourth position on stage, 7.9s behind EVA . ROV was in fifth place on stage, with a time of 639.4s . LAP was in sixth on stage, 10.9s behind stage winner EVA in a time of 639.8s, just 0.4s off ROV. OGI took seventh position on stage, 11.8s behind stage winner EVA, just 0.9s off LAP. GRE was in eighth on stage, 15.5s behind OGI and moved up one place to eighth overall. FOU took ninth on stage, with a time of 663.3s and moved up one place to ninth overall. 8.3 Driver Report, SS8 - OGI OGI took seventh position on stage, 11.8s behind stage winner EVA, just 0.9s off LAP. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 9.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times ROV took second position on stage, 1.7s behind stage winner EVA in a time of 416.7s . BRE took third place on stage, 1.4s further back behind ROV . TÄN was in fourth place on stage, with a time of 418.7s , just 0.6s further back behind BRE. LAP took fifth position on stage, with a time of 418.7s with the same time as TÄN. OGI was in sixth place on stage, with a time of 423.1s . NEU took seventh position on stage, 1.6s behind OGI . GRE took eighth place on stage, 23.0s behind EVA in a time of 438.0s . FOU took ninth place on stage, with a time of 439.5s . KAT was in forty-first on stage, 600.0s behind the stage winner, well back on FOU, who was 323.1s faster. 9.3 Driver Report, SS9 - OGI OGI was in sixth place on stage, with a time of 423.1s . These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 10.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times took the stage win and kept hold of the overall lead of the rally taking a time of 619.8s. BRE took second on stage, with a time of 621.4s . TÄN took third on stage, 2.1s behind BRE . LAP took fourth position on stage, with a time of 627.0s and moved up one place to fourth overall. NEU took fifth place on stage, with a time of 627.2s and moved up one place to fifth overall, only 0.2s further back behind LAP. OGI took sixth position on stage, 9.9s behind EVA and moved up one place to sixth overall. GRE took seventh on stage, 18.8s behind OGI and moved up one place to seventh overall. FOU was in eighth position on stage, with a time of 657.2s and moved up one place to eighth overall. KAT was in thirty-ninth place on stage, 600.0s behind stage winner EVA, well back on FOU, who was 337.1s quicker. ROV took fortieth place on stage, 600.0s behind stage winner EVA dropped five places to ninth overall matching the time of KAT. 10.3 Driver Report, SS10 - OGI OGI took sixth position on stage, 9.9s behind EVA and moved up one place to sixth overall. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 11.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times Pace relative to the stage winner. 12.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 12.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times marking a time of 618.5s. EVA took second place on stage, 1.2s behind stage winner TÄN in a time of 619.7s kept hold of the overall lead of the rally. BRE was in third place on stage, with a time of 620.5s dropped one place to third overall and just 0.8s further behind EVA. LAP took fourth position on stage, with a time of 621.4s and just 0.9s further behind BRE. OGI was in fifth on stage, 4.1s behind stage winner TÄN in a time of 622.6s . NEU took sixth position on stage, 4.9s behind the stage winner in a time of 623.4s , only 0.8s further back behind OGI. GRE took seventh place on stage, with a time of 635.2s . FOU took eighth on stage, 14.5s behind GRE . KAT took thirty-eighth position on stage, with a time of 1218.5s, well back on FOU, who was 174.5s faster. ROV was in thirty-ninth on stage, with a time of 1218.5s with the same time as KAT. 12.3 Driver Report, SS12 - OGI OGI was in fifth on stage, 4.1s behind stage winner TÄN in a time of 622.6s . These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 13.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 14.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times marking a time of 609.2s. TÄN was in second place on stage, with a time of 610.6s . BRE was in third on stage, with a time of 615.4s . OGI took fourth on stage, 1.8s further back behind BRE and moved up one place to fifth overall. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 15.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 16.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 17.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times SS17: EVA took the stage and kept hold of the overall lead of the rally taking a time of 325.5s. TÄN took second on stage, with a time of 329.0s . BRE took third on stage, 5.7s behind EVA . LAP took fourth on stage, 6.6s behind the stage winner in a time of 332.1s , only 0.9s further back behind BRE. OGI took fifth place on stage, 7.2s behind the stage winner and just 0.6s further back behind LAP. KAT took sixth position on stage, with a time of 335.7s . FOU was in seventh on stage, with a time of 338.1s . GRE was in eighth place on stage, 13.3s behind EVA, just 0.7s off FOU. ROV took eighteenth on stage, 39.2s behind stage winner EVA in a time of 364.7s . 17.3 Driver Report, SS17 - OGI OGI took fifth place on stage, 7.2s behind the stage winner and just 0.6s further back behind LAP. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 18.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 19.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times
